name: Hampton Inn & Suites Chicago - Downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a find. Yes it is two star but it is more like a 3 star hotel. The beds are big and comfy. The hotel was quiet. There is a fridge in the room. The Bathrooms are big. Breakfast was included but can get crowded. We paid an internet rate of $134/night and had WIFI. We arrived at 5 am on a red eye, room was ready, and we even had a full breakfast before going to bed. The hotel is near the italian pizzerias (e,.g. Ginos) and hot dog places. There is a Nordstrom right across the street and a 7-11. Shopping is right there off the Magnificent Mile. You do need a taxi or transit to get to the museums (e.g. Chicago Art Museum). Lastly, washing machines on premise, what more do you want?
reviews.title: Great price, great location, and better than expected

reviews.text: This is a perfectly adequate, nice little hotel in a good location in Chicago near the Magnificent Mile and the Loop. Its rooms are nice, even if they aren't fancy. Great blankets on the beds. The staff is very helpful, the pool and hot tub are nice, and the restaurants in the building are quite good as well.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, too bad it's next to a firehouse

likes.disliked: — Location next to a noisy, busy firehouse

reviews.text: But it needs to be said that if you stay at this hotel you risk hearing sirens at all hours of the day due to the firehouse next door. We even requested a room change to the side of the building farthest from the firehouse (which the staff granted us as soon as they could), but we still heard sirens.
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem!!

reviews.text: I knew about the firehouse before I booked, thanks to this website. However, it didn't seem to bother most of the reviewers, and some people we talked to at the hotel also didn't seem bothered by it. After I got some earplugs it wasn't much of a problem for me either. But it's something to take into consideration.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: P.S. I am from New York City, so it's not like I'm not used to city noises.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Quiet, Roomy

likes.liked: — every staff person was friendly; excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel suites are very large considering you are in downtown Chicago. Our king suite had a full size refrigerator, stove, microwave oven, and dishes. They provided free breakfast, and free coffee and tea 24 hours a day. The location is very convenient and a couple of blocks from Michigan Ave. The rooms need a little remodeling, though, but are clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Pretty good hotel

likes.liked: — The large size of the suites

reviews.text: Throughout our many years of traveling, we always try to book our hotel reservations downtown in any city we plan to visit., and usually always a suite. We are just back from visiting the Amercian Girl Place in Chicago and this proved to be a great location and an easy walk to our destination. We booked a corner suite with an adjoining room. It was just perfect for the four adults and four children in our party. The rooms were spacious, very, very, clean and well kept, and had wonderful sleeping queen size beds with down comforters. The staff was so accommodating and met any request that we had promptly, and I might add, - with a smile. The personal Ambassador, Samra went out of her way with giving of her time with great suggestions on where to eat. I just can't say enough about her! I definitely plan on returning to that Hampton Inn when I return with friends for a planned Christmas trip in December. Thank you staff for a wonderful stay.!
reviews.title: Loved Our Stay Here -- Just Wonderful

likes.liked: — Large Suite Rooms and the Cleanliness,- also the friendly staff
likes.disliked: — If anything, - the fire engines that went out at night which was no problem with the noise filtering machines that we brought with us

reviews.text: We loved this hotel; I have 3 boys ages 8-12 the suites were roomy and spacious to afford all five of us our comfort. The staff was pleasant and very accommodating. We stayed two nights and three days. We took the train in from Grand Rapids, MI so we arrived at 11:30 am and the room was not available, however, the bellhop checked our luggage and we went exploring. The first night I won a gift $50.00 certificate to Bella’s restaurant!! The locating was great; close the ESPN Zone and shopping. The Rock Bottom brewery was a great place for lunch- excellent food and not too pricey. We will stay here again!!
reviews.title: Quiet and Comfort in the City

likes.liked: — Convenience, comfort, cleanliness, helpful staff, price

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed with our 4 year old and 7 year old at the Hampton Inn and Suites for two nights during Holy Week. I would highly recommend this hotel to families with young children who want to take advantage of a hotel with more reasonable rates.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for the Family!

likes.liked: — The staff , the complimentary breakfast, the beds, and the location.

reviews.text: The staff was extremely pleasant on the phone. I called a few days before we arrived to ask about a roll-away bed for our youngest. I did not know one was available when I made the reservations. The first night was going to cost us $40 more than the second night, but the gentleman I talked to knocked off the $40 so both nights were at the lower rate. Needless to say I was glad I called back.
reviews.title: Hampton Thumbs Up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone at the hotel was extremely friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was great for us, and my only complaint about our entire stay was the eggs (or whatever they really were). They were awful! Otherise there was plenty to fill the kids up in the morning. The kids also liked the complimentary apples and cookies in the lobby.
reviews.title: Great choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was comfortable. We stayed in a room with two double beds and paid a little more for a roll-away so the kids could have separate beds. Our room, on the fourth floor, overlooked the pool area, and so the noise from the fire station was minimal. We also used a sound machine with the kids, so we did have a rather peaceful sleep. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. The room and bathroom were clean and sufficient for our needs.
reviews.title: Great stay - Loved every minuite

likes.liked: — Everything, Great Beds Great Staff Great time
likes.disliked: — Leaving to go home, having to get out of bed!

reviews.text: We bought two day M.T.A. passes at the Jewel 1 1/2 blocks north of the hotel on State. We used the bus stop on Illinois just east of State to get to Navy Pier. The free Navy Pier Trolley stops there too, but we did not use it since we had the passes. The red line stop is just one block north of the hotel on State/Grand. We used that to get to Shedd. Aquarium. You take the red line to Roosevelt and transfer to Bus #12. The hotel is in a great location for getting around via public transportation.
reviews.title: Great 3 Night Stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hampton the last weekend of January. We were only there for one night, but we wish it could've been longer. The moment we checked in, hotel staff was willing to find us the best room for our needs. We requested a room as far away from the fire station as possible since we had a 7 month old baby with us. We got just what we asked for. Our room was exactly as it was pictured on the websites. It was up to date with mission style furniture and 1920s style stained glass light fixtures. Nothing looked worn or dirty. The carpet was in great condition. You notice these things when you have a baby playing on the floor a lot. All the furniture was substantial and comfortable. The king bed looked inviting with a cozy duvet and crisp comfortable pillows. The bathroom was not particularly modern or special in any way, but it was clean and practical. We were surprised at how roomy the entire suite was. It was bigger than we expected with a spacious living area, kitchen with full-size appliances and lots of extra room in the bedroom. There was plenty of room for our family of 4 including a 6 yr old and infant.
reviews.title: Hampton Perfect for Family of 4

reviews.text: During our stay we especially loved the following things:
reviews.title: Downtown living
overnight getaway
reviews.text: The most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept on--really, it was absolutely wonderful. A quality fold-out bed for kids in the living room. A decent hot breakfast with a little something for everyone. Free internet in the room, but if you don't bring your laptop, free use of the hotel computer room (with internet, printers, faxes, etc). Nice pool and work-out room. Very friendly staff. Great location to all that downtown Chicago has to offer...all within walking distance. Lastly, we loved the sense of calm and quiet you get when you step into the hotel after being on the bustling city streets. Some hotels are as busy and crowded inside as the city is outside. But every time we stepped into the Hampton, it felt like a quiet, relaxed respite from all that was happening outside. It was warm and comfortable. We will definitely stay there again. With the AAA rate, we stayed for less than $150 a night with all taxes included. Parking is $30 for the day or $38 for valet (well worth it). Downtown Chicago hotels do not have to cost a lot. This hotel had everything we needed and plenty of what we wanted in luxury and comfort.

I am writing this review from my room during my week stay at the hotel... I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room. I am in a corner room suite which is huge. The "suites" include a full kitchen, living room, dining table and separate bedroom with vanity and king bed. The room has nice decor and they have done a good job bringing it up to date.
reviews.title: Great hotel. Would stay there again

reviews.text: I am on the 10th floor (I think there are 12) and you hear the typical horns and trucks from the streets below, which is not too uncommon at downtown locations. I think some other hotels may do a better job of soundproofing the windows. Given this hotel is fairly old, the windows may allow for additional "ambiance" to creep in.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at the Hampton
